channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: NAIDOC Week
item.description:
Sunday, July 2, 2023

City Hall will be lit in the colours of the Aboriginal (red, black and yellow) and Torres Strait Islander Flag (white, blue, green, white) to recognise NAIDOC Week.

NAIDOC Week recognises and celebrates the culture, history, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. NAIDOC Week will be held from 2-9 July 2023, honouring this year’s theme of ‘For Our Elders’.

Across every generation, our Elders have played, and continue to play an important role and hold a prominent place in our communities and families.

Elders play an extremely important role in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander families as care providers, educators, cultural knowledge holders, trailblazers, advocates, survivors, leaders, hard workers, role models and are strongly relied upon as key decision makers within families and communities. They hold the greatest respect because many of them experienced severe injustices to ensure succeeding generations do not suffer the same. It is through the Elders that the spirit of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is kept alive.

We pay our respects to the Elders who have passed into the dreaming and to those who continue to provide strength, support and guidance for us all; we pay homage to them.

In 2023, how will you celebrate ‘For Our Elders’?

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: NAIDOC Week
item.description:
Tuesday, July 4, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit in the colours of the Aboriginal (red, black and yellow) and Torres Strait Islander Flag (white, blue, green, white) to recognise NAIDOC Week.

NAIDOC Week recognises and celebrates the culture, history, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. NAIDOC Week will be held from 2-9 July 2023, honouring this year’s theme of ‘For Our Elders’.

Across every generation, our Elders have played, and continue to play an important role and hold a prominent place in our communities and families.

Elders play an extremely important role in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander families as care providers, educators, cultural knowledge holders, trailblazers, advocates, survivors, leaders, hard workers, role models and are strongly relied upon as key decision makers within families and communities. They hold the greatest respect because many of them experienced severe injustices to ensure succeeding generations do not suffer the same. It is through the Elders that the spirit of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is kept alive.

We pay our respects to the Elders who have passed into the dreaming and to those who continue to provide strength, support and guidance for us all; we pay homage to them.

In 2023, how will you celebrate ‘For Our Elders’?

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Elders play an extremely important role in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander families as care providers, educators, cultural knowledge holders, trailblazers, advocates, survivors, leaders, hard workers, role models and are strongly relied upon as key decision makers within families and communities. They hold the greatest respect because many of them experienced severe injustices to ensure succeeding generations do not suffer the same. It is through the Elders that the spirit of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is kept alive.
We pay our respects to the Elders who have passed into the dreaming and to those who continue to provide strength, support and guidance for us all; we pay homage to them.
In 2023, how will you celebrate ‘For Our Elders’?
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit in the colours of the Aboriginal (red, black and yellow) and Torres Strait Islander Flag (white, blue, green, white) to recognise NAIDOC Week.
NAIDOC Week recognises and celebrates the culture, history, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. NAIDOC Week will be held from 2-9 July 2023, honouring this year’s theme of ‘For Our Elders’.
Across every generation, our Elders have played, and continue to play an important role and hold a prominent place in our communities and families.
Elders play an extremely important role in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander families as care providers, educators, cultural knowledge holders, trailblazers, advocates, survivors, leaders, hard workers, role models and are strongly relied upon as key decision makers within families and communities. They hold the greatest respect because many of them experienced severe injustices to ensure succeeding generations do not suffer the same. It is through the Elders that the spirit of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is kept alive.
We pay our respects to the Elders who have passed into the dreaming and to those who continue to provide strength, support and guidance for us all; we pay homage to them.
In 2023, how will you celebrate ‘For Our Elders’?
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

In 2023, how will you celebrate ‘For Our Elders’?

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
item.xCal:description:
The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to recognise NAIDOC Week.
NAIDOC Week recognises and celebrates the culture, history, and achievements of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. NAIDOC Week will be held from 2-9 July 2023, honouring this year’s theme of ‘For Our Elders’.
Across every generation, our Elders have played, and continue to play an important role and hold a prominent place in our communities and families.
Elders play an extremely important role in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander families as care providers, educators, cultural knowledge holders, trailblazers, advocates, survivors, leaders, hard workers, role models and are strongly relied upon as key decision makers within families and communities. They hold the greatest respect because many of them experienced severe injustices to ensure succeeding generations do not suffer the same. It is through the Elders that the spirit of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is kept alive.
We pay our respects to the Elders who have passed into the dreaming and to those who continue to provide strength, support and guidance for us all; we pay homage to them.
In 2023, how will you celebrate ‘For Our Elders’?
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 National Diabetes Week
item.description:
Monday, July 10, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to support 2023 National Diabetes Week.

Diabetes Queensland is a charity and membership organisation that has been providing education, advice, ongoing support and advocacy to Queenslanders living with diabetes and those at risk, for more than 50 years. Today, 1 in 4 Queenslanders is either living with or at risk of developing diabetes; making it the number one cost to the health dollar and Australia’s fastest-growing chronic disease. The annual National Diabetes week raises awareness and funds to help Diabetes Queensland achieve its objectives.

This Light Up is organised by: Diabetes Australia

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Orange Sky July
item.description:
Tuesday, July 11, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support Orange Sky July.

Orange Sky July is our national campaign to raise money and awareness of people experiencing homelessness. From sitting down on our orange chairs and chatting with friends, we've learnt that although access to laundry and shower services is important, it's the conversation and regular connection that create the biggest impact in the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Orange Sky Australia Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Gambling Harm Awareness Week
item.description:
Monday, July 17, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to support Gambling Harm Awareness Week.

Gambling Harm Awareness Week is an annual event in Queensland that aims to increase awareness of gambling harms, safer gambling practices and the help available to the people affected by gambling problems. If gambling has become a problem for you, or someone you care about, get some help. It’s free and confidential.

This Light Up is organised by: Relationships Australia Qld

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Matildas
item.description:
Tuesday, July 18, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support Matildas.

The FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023 is the biggest women’s sporting event in the world, and it’s happening right here on Australian soil! The USA are the defending World champions, and will be looking for their fifth World Title, but they will have some mighty opposition. In preparation for this we wish the Matilda’s all the best of luck as they kick off the tournament against Ireland in the opening sell out match.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

In preparation for this we wish the Matilda’s all the best of luck as they kick off the tournament against Ireland in the opening sell out match.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: International AIDS Society and HIV Science
item.description:
Wednesday, July 19, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support International Aids Society and HIV Science.

International AIDS Society convenes, educates and advocates for a world in which HIV no longer presents a threat to public health and individual well-being.

The IAS 2023, being held at the Brisbane Convention and Exhibition Centre, will shine a spotlight on the world's advances in HIV research, and is the world’s most influential meeting on HIV research and its applications. This biennial conference presents the critical advances in basic, clinical and operational HIV research that move science into policy and practice. Through its open and inclusive programme, the meeting sets the gold standard of HIV science, featuring highly diverse and cutting-edge research.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 National Pyjama Day
item.description:
Thursday, July 20, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support Eve of 2023 National Pyjama Day.

National Pyjama Day is all about wearing your favourite pair of PJ’s to help The Pyjama Foundation raise much needed awareness and funds for children in foster care.

The Pyjama Foundation supports the educational outcomes for children in foster care through the Love of Learning Program. Volunteers, known as Pyjama Angels, spend time with children in care once a week reading books aloud, playing educational games and engaging in fun learning-based activities. Most importantly, a Pyjama Angels role is to provide consistent friendship and support for the child, teaching them that they are valued.

This Light Up is organised by: The Pyjama Foundation Ltd

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: FIFA Women's World Cup
item.description:
Thursday, July 20, 2023

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink, Green, White, Light Blue and Yellow to celebrate FIFA Women's World Cup.

From 20 July to 20 August, Aotearoa/New Zealand and Australia will co-host the FIFA Women’s World Cup. This will be the first time that the tournament will be co-hosted across two countries and Brisbane/Meaajin is proud to be one of the nine Host Cities.

As well as hosting matches, a Fan Festival™ in Brisbane/Meaanjin will take place at the South Bank Parklands, offering the perfect place to watch live FIFA Women’s World Cup™ matches and enjoy an exciting program of music, entertainment, food and games.  

Find out more at FIFA Women’s World Cup Australia & New Zealand 2023™

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Belgian National Day
item.description:
Friday, July 21, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Black, Yellow and Red to recognise Belgian National Day.

The Queensland Consulate of Belgium would like to welcome the Queensland community to join with them to celebrate the Belgium National Day, on July 21. This commemorates the day on which Leopold I took the constitutional oath as the first King of Belgium, on July 21st 1831.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Consulte of Belgium

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Brisbane French Festival
item.description:
Friday, July 21, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate Brisbane French Festival.

After a 3-year break, Le Festival is returning – to a new location: Victoria Park/Barrambin on July 21st– 23rd. Brisbane is invited to a ‘magnifique’ experience ‘a la française’ enjoying French and French-inspired exhibitors at the French Market and Artists & Artisans’ tent, food, Champagne, with entertainment and live performances. Put on your béret, style your stripes, bring your baguette, channel your chic… and be a part of Le Festival 2023!

This Light Up is organised by: Le Festival

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 World Fragile X Day
item.description:
Saturday, July 22, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support 2023 World Fragile X Day.

Fragile X Association of Australian is a registered charity providing support, information, and education to people with Fragile X syndrome and their families/carers. (Fragile X syndrome is the leading cause of inherited intellectual disability and a single-gene cause of autism). We are a national, member-based organisation. Our mission is to improve the lives of individuals affected by Fragile X. We have been operating for around 33 years. We have members, and Board members, in all states. World Fragile X Day raises awareness of Fragile X syndrome and promotes understanding, acceptance and inclusion of people with Fragile X and, more broadly, all people with intellectual disability. 2023 marks the 8th year of our "light up" campaign; Brisbane was the first city to embrace Fragile X Awareness Day in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Fragile X Association of Australia

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

(Fragile X syndrome is the leading cause of inherited intellectual disability and a single-gene cause of autism). We are a national, member-based organisation. Our mission is to improve the lives of individuals affected by Fragile X. We have been operating for around 33 years. We have members, and Board members, in all states. World Fragile X Day raises awareness of Fragile X syndrome and promotes understanding, acceptance and inclusion of people with Fragile X and, more broadly, all people with intellectual disability. 2023 marks the 8th year of our "light up" campaign; Brisbane was the first city to embrace Fragile X Awareness Day in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Fragile X Association of Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
